title: Audio signal interpolation using optimal transportation of spectrograms
author: David Valdivia (IRIT, Université de Toulouse), Marien Renaud (IMB, Université de Bordeaux), Elsa Cazelles (IRIT, CNRS, Université de Toulouse), Cédric Févotte (IRIT, CNRS, Université de Toulouse), ...
relevance_why: This paper introduces a novel method for audio signal interpolation, utilizing optimal transport techniques that can potentially enhance the quality of audio generation tasks in Dr. Liu's research on text-to-audio generation and music synthesis.
background: Audio signal interpolation aims to create a seamless audio signal that transitions between two distinct source and target audio signals, providing a hybrid sound.
contribution: This paper introduces an interpolation technique based on Wasserstein barycenters of spectrograms to generate intermediate audio signals, achieving more nuanced and realistic sound transitions.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often treat audio frames independently or lack a structured approach to transport energy effectively across the time-frequency domain.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves inter-frame transportation by employing a structured cost matrix to limit distant mass displacements, enhancing audio realism.

key_innovation: The method's unique approach of using a structured cost matrix in optimal transport prevents unrealistic energy shifts in audio, maintaining the integrity of the source and target signals.
real_world_impact: The proposed method has potential applications in audio editing, sound design, and synthesis, offering new tools for creative professionals and enhancing interactive audio experiences.
limitations: The computational complexity of optimal transport calculations may limit applicability to very high-resolution audio signals.

new_terms.Wasserstein barycenter: **Wasserstein barycenter** refers to a type of average that minimizes the cost of transporting distributions in a probabilistic context, ensuring optimal similarity across spatial representations.
new_terms.optimal transport: **Optimal transport** is a mathematical theory dealing with the most cost-effective way to move distributions and ideas across a predefined space.

open_sourcing: Supplemental materials and audio samples are available online.
